data.title: Teaser Trailer
data.text:
Check out the US trailer or White Fang, the latest animated movie directed by Alexandre Espigares based on the 1906 novel of the same name by Jack London and featuring the voices of Rashida Jones, Nick Offerman, Paul Giamatti, Flula Borg, Virginie Efira, Dominique Pinon, Stephen Kramer Glickman, Eddie Spears, Raphaël Personnaz, Raquel Antonia, David Boat, Daniel Hagen, Jason Grasl, Ginnie Watson, and Tom Morton:

WHITE FANGPlot synopsis:

“Based on Jack London’s classic novel ‘White Fang’, this animated feature film is a touching, adventure-filled tale about the life of White Fang, a wolf dog who’s life unfold from being a puppy in the wild to dog-fighting in Fort Yukon.”

Definitely a beautiful movie! Have you seen it yet? What did you think? Tell us in the comments below!

US release date: July 6, 2018 (on Netflix).

:)

There’s a first official trailer for White Fang, the upcoming animated movie directed by Spanish-Luxembourgish Filmmaker Alexandre Espigares from a script by Serge Frydman, Philippe Lioret, and Dominique Monfery based on the 1906 novel of the same name by American author Jack London, the trailer is in French but definitely worth seeing:

WHITE FANGPlot synopsis:

“Based on the timeless novel by Jack London, White Fang follows the story of a boy who befriends a half breed wolf as he searches for his father, who has mysteriously gone missing during the Gold Rush.”

There are also two film posters, take a look below:

(Click on a poster to enlarge.)

WHITE FANG

And a few pictures from the film:

(Click on a picture to enlarge.)

I remember reading the novel when I was a kid and I really liked it. So am glad to hear about this animated movie, impatient to see it!

No official US release date, but the film will hit French theaters on March 28, 2018.

Stay tuned for more details!

:)
